author: experience_
content: Why do you consider 1559 a fiasco?

author: lightclient
content:
> - Unmined
>    gasPrice  (for Legacy transaction) 
>    maxFeeCapPerGas (for 1559 transaction)
> - Mined
>    effectivePriorityFeePerGas (for 1559 transaction)
>    gasPrice (for Legacy transaction)
this is correct though

author: bculberson
content: I think there should be a post-mortem on 1559 in that it took over 2 years from proposal to implementation. Did it add enough value to justify that kind of commitment? Were there other ways to achieve same result? ex: if the concern is paying too much for security just burn some portion of the gas on every block. hopefully that could have been done in months, not years.

author: barnabemonnot
content:
there are already and there will be many many more post-mortems ("continuous evaluation" is perhaps a happier term than post-mortem...)

also burning x% of the gas doesn't work, users would just set their gas price to 0 and move off-chain to pay miners. a lot of "simple" solutions seem clean and easy to implement but there are intricacies to the mechanism that can also explain why it took time to get right/vet enough for mainnet, on top of the usual process

author: bculberson
content: i'd be all for proposals that limit the miners ability to cherry pick transactions like that... that would actually help with mev also. as is, just seems like a lot of work for a trivial improvement

author: bculberson
content: i look forward to real improvements in scale/throughput/cost of tx/arbitrage

author: bculberson
content: a way to make transaction costs known ahead of time is to have so much throughput that they are always fixed cost

author: nationdomi
content:
Hello!, i have a question, i am currently trying to swap to ETH using metamask, and the gas fee estimates `0.00541 ETH` but the max is `0.05442 ETH` and i can't do the swap without having `0.05442 ETH` which is a very high fee max (for me)
what happens if i lower the max fee? and what are the chances of me running out of gass mid transaction?

author: nationdomi
content: https://i.gyazo.com/2c8d3a66ed75fee43fef116cd58cab0e.png since this already happened to me

author: nationdomi
content: how do i know that my transaction wont take over 100$?

author: trent_vanepps
content: i'd update your MM first to v10 to benefit from 1559 style type 2 tx

author: trent_vanepps
content: possibly, but probably not. you can check here: https://etherscan.io/chart/gasprice or here: https://dune.xyz/yulesa/EIP-1559-KIP to track historic / recent trends
